text: Paying off student loans felt like conquering Mt. Everest back then.
Wind changes sails; we adjust – story of maturing for me.
Became real quick after losing my spouse - facing bills alone plus silence at home really seals the deal. It’s not just paperwork; it feels like someone hits fast-forward on your life script.
Every engineer supposedly has tons of pens lying around - actually true for me! Always have one handy just in case yet ironically always seem to be borrowing them during meetings.
Boundary setting between work and play's been key for me – tricky stuff balancing all those tight deadlines with quality down-time back home!

Oh please, as if somehow reaching 30 flips a switch inside you making you "adult" overnight. If anything, it ramps up those annoying questions from everyone expecting you to have your life script sorted out already.
